ci_support_linux_64_r_base4.4.yaml:
cdt_name:
- conda
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
cran_mirror:
- https://cran.r-project.org
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
pin_run_as_build:
  r-base:
    min_pin: x.x
    max_pin: x.x
r_base:
- '4.4'
target_platform:
- linux-64

about.summary: In ancient Chinese mythology, Bai Ze is a divine creature that knows the needs of everything. 'baizer' provides data processing functions frequently used by the author. Hope this package also knows what you want!

In ancient Chinese mythology, Bai Ze is a divine creature that knows the needs of everything. 'baizer' provides data processing functions frequently used by the author. Hope this package also knows what you want!

name: r-baizer
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set version = '0.8.0' %}
{% set posix = 'm2-' if win else '' %}

package:
  name: r-baizer
  version: {{ version|replace("-", "_") }}

source:
  url:
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/baizer_{{ version }}.tar.gz
    - {{ cran_mirror }}/src/contrib/Archive/baizer/baizer_{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 2ab9c74ba501cd4b44ece378d166eef41ada831e43bac1ec169eb07fc379c719

build:
  number: 1
  noarch: generic
  rpaths:
    - lib/R/lib/
    - lib/
  missing_dso_whitelist:
    - '*/R.dll'        # [win]
    - '*/Rblas.dll'    # [win]
    - '*/Rlapack.dll'  # [win]

requirements:
  build:
    - {{ posix }}zip               # [win]
    - cross-r-base {{ r_base }}    # [build_platform != target_platform]
  host:
    - r-base
    - r-curl
    - r-diffobj
    - r-dplyr >=1.1.0
    - r-magrittr
    - r-openxlsx
    - r-purrr
    - r-readr
    - r-readxl
    - r-rematch2
    - r-rlang >=0.4.11
    - r-rmarkdown
    - r-seriation
    - r-stringr
    - r-tibble >=3.1
    - r-tidyr
    - r-vctrs
  run:
    - r-base
    - r-curl
    - r-diffobj
    - r-dplyr >=1.1.0
    - r-magrittr
    - r-openxlsx
    - r-purrr
    - r-readr
    - r-readxl
    - r-rematch2
    - r-rlang >=0.4.11
    - r-rmarkdown
    - r-seriation
    - r-stringr
    - r-tibble >=3.1
    - r-tidyr
    - r-vctrs

test:
  commands:
    - $R -e "library('baizer')"           # [not win]
    - "\"%R%\" -e \"library('baizer')\""  # [win]

about:
  home: https://william-swl.github.io/baizer/, https://github.com/william-swl/baizer
  license: MIT
  summary: In ancient Chinese mythology, Bai Ze is a divine creature that knows the needs of
    everything. 'baizer' provides data processing functions frequently used by the author.
    Hope this package also knows what you want!
  license_family: MIT
  license_file:
    - '{{ environ["PREFIX"] }}/lib/R/share/licenses/MIT'
    - LICENSE

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - conda-forge/r

# Package: baizer
# Title: Useful Functions for Data Processing
# Version: 0.8.0
# Authors@R: person("William", "Song", , "william_swl@163.com", role = c("aut", "cre"))
# Description: In ancient Chinese mythology, Bai Ze is a divine creature that knows the needs of everything. 'baizer' provides data processing functions frequently used by the author. Hope this package also knows what you want!
# License: MIT + file LICENSE
# Encoding: UTF-8
# RoxygenNote: 7.2.3
# Imports: curl, diffobj, dplyr (>= 1.1.0), grDevices, magrittr, methods, openxlsx, purrr, readr, readxl, rematch2, rlang (>= 0.4.11), rmarkdown, seriation, stats, stringr, tibble (>= 3.1), tidyr, utils, vctrs
# Suggests: covr, roxygen2, testthat (>= 3.0.0), withr
# Config/testthat/edition: 3
# Depends: R (>= 3.5.0)
# LazyData: true
# URL: https://william-swl.github.io/baizer/, https://github.com/william-swl/baizer
# BugReports: https://github.com/william-swl/baizer/issues
# NeedsCompilation: no
# Packaged: 2023-10-19 08:31:45 UTC; william
# Author: William Song [aut, cre]
# Maintainer: William Song <william_swl@163.com>
# Repository: CRAN
# Date/Publication: 2023-10-19 09:00:02 UTC
